ĞĞµ Ğ·Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´ Ğ¼Ğ½Ğµ ĞĞ§Ğ•ĞĞ¬ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ½Ñ€Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ, Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ¾Ğ¹, Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ„ĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¹, Ğ° Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµÑ‚ Ğ¸ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¸ Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼, Ğ²ĞµĞ´ÑŒ Ğ¾Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹ÑĞ¾Ñ‚Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾! Ğ˜ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞºĞ¸ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ, ÑƒĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğµ Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ğ» :D
 
Vladuhius
112 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 2 mai 2022
Pros:
- Great level design
- Fair difficulty that progresses linearly
- New creative testing elements
- Great music

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- The story is mediocre, and the voices can be annoying at times, but its really not that big of a deal.

Summary:
Rexaura is an amazing extension to the original portal with many new and creative elements. The story is mediocre, but besides that the mod is nearly flawless.

PS: Some people may take issue with the amount of energy pellets, I can understand this, but the levels are very clever and implement them well.

Also, if you read a review saying the mod is bad because its based on "timing" they either quit the game because they couldn't figure out the actual solution, or they are 98 years old and cannot place a portal in a 5 second window. There is next to no execution required. If you find yourself struggling to time something, you're probably missing something important.
 
Blastimbre
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

åœ¨åŸç‰ˆçš„åŸºç¡€ä¸Šæ›´æ”¹å’Œå¢åŠ äº†æ–°çš„æœºåˆ¶ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¢åŠ äº†éš¾åº¦()ï¼Œå¥–åŠ±æˆ¿é—´é‚£éš¾åº¦çœŸä¸æ˜¯ç»™æ™®é€šäººç©çš„ã€‚

392 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
9.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 dÃ©cembre 2020
Wonderful fan mod. Awesome developer. Excellently designed puzzles. A hearty recommendation from me!

Pros:
- Smart, well-paced Portal puzzles
- (Slightly) new Portal puzzle elements
- Awesome music!
- Secrets, achievements, and bonus levels!
- Full voice-over with great voices!
- Satisfying little mini-campaign
- It's free!

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- While the voices are good, the writing is kinda bland and cringey in my opinion
- The solution for the 2nd hidden cake felt really arbitrary and stupid to me honestly
- There are some cases where you keep having a new energy pellet spawn and immediately get destroyed, and the repeated destruction sound effect plus screenshake every six seconds is *really* obnoxious... I recommend muting the game audio in settings in those cases
- The Aperture Diet achievement needs to be done in a single save file, playing through at least chambers 11 to 18 sequentially without skipping around between levels in the menu, which is annoying but not the end of the world
- No developer's commentary? But I wanted to hear from Benjamin... :P

Pros:
- None of those above things matter and I'm just joking around with ya
- It's free
- It's more Portal
- AWESOME MUSIC
- IT'S FREE
 
Gunnar Clovis

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 aout 2020
All of puzzles centered around energy pallets and with new features this mod brings unique and fun experience.
Puzzles are about logic and once you figured out how to solve them you wouldn't have any problem with timing.
It dosen't have special story but its characters and their dialogues are fun and entertaining.
It's free and definitively worth trying.

Ğ¥Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´ Ğ½Ğ° Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ». ĞĞ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ»Ğ¸ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾-Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·-Ğ·Ğ° Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ñ‹ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ñ‹.
 
Ğ‘ÑƒĞ»Ñ
103 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 octobre 2018
So as this is a free mod to portal, a few notes going in. Everything you know about portal gameplay applies to this mod, with one exception. That being energy pellets destroy all cubes when they bounce off.

So this mod is centered around the high energy pellet. Which is fine, it provides nineteen interesting test chambers from which to solve puzzles with new elements and mechanics. These new elements fit seamlessly into the atmosphere of portal. Feels like the sort of thing Apature science would come up with. Nothing is thrown at you too fast to understand it.

The two narrators are great, lots of fun commentary and lines, gave me several chuckles. And things are expalined nicely when said.

That said the puzzles themselves start easy, but to ramp up. To a difficulty grade above the original portal sometimes. Lots of critical thinking and round about methodology is required. That is not nessassarily a bad thing, but it can make is very frustrating sometimes.

/*-SPOILERS BELOW ON STORY-*/
The story ending is the biggest let down of this mod. It builds and builds and then, just stops abruptly. No payoff to the build up at all.

Overall highly recommended, just prepare for a few let downs as it is very much not perfect.
 
Adreos

NEON-MASTER
167 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 fÃ©vrier 2021
Uniquely challenging and incredibly satisfying. This mod was seriously fun to play through, as someone who's finished Portal many times over and wanted to see its puzzle elements used in new ways. There were several times I had to walk away from a puzzle for a while, completely stumped, only to come back later with a fresh perspective and get it in one go. I love the way this expands on the energy pellet; it's one of the puzzle elements I loved from Portal and missed in Portal 2. This mod really pushes the player to think outside the box, and it teaches the player techniques that come in handy in later puzzles. Like all good puzzle games, it builds on itself, and once you've become familiar with certain elements it adds a new layer to make things more challenging. Seriously loved this. Like vanilla Portal, I'll probably end up playing it all the way through multiple times, just because the puzzles are so satisfying to complete.
 
GhostwrittenGhoul

0
RecommandÃ©
12.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 mai 2020
I think Rexaura has a case of too much going on - the tests are huge and its not immediately obvious what is going on in the chamber. This makes it so there's an ambiguous skill barrier for the later chambers, usually requiring you to have played both Portals before, even if the starting section is very tutorial-esque.

However, this mod was wonderfully executed, and I still recommend it if you haven't tried it.
 
Marty

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
2.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 dÃ©cembre 2023
Rexaura is a mod for Portal 1 heavily focused on energy pellets. The mod features new puzzle elements that even appear in Portal 2's BEE Mod for custom levels. These new elements are interesting, but I think the actual level design's focus on time is greatly annoying. Namely, it doesn't feel like it's based on timing the pellets but rather wasting your time as you wait for the energy pellet to go its course.

There was a reason why energy pellets were replaced by lasers in Portal 2, and this mod does a great job showing why.

I think there is a difference between simply making a puzzle and making a fun puzzle, and this isn't fun.
 
kalani

1,038 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 avril 2016
From the Portal fan who brought you advanced portal maps in the past, Mevious rises from the ashes to bring another expert challenge to the table with new features. These new features include: energy balls that destroy your box, the returning "Never-dying" energy ball, and stationary anti-energy balls.

These are not master-level difficulty levels that require portal ninjas to play, but you will end up looking at guides between Rooms/Chapters/Levels 10-19. And you won't be dealing with turrets for once (Thank goodness).

These maps seem to be harder than Portal Stories: Mel (Story Mode), which would be considered Advanced difficulty, but easier than Portal Stories: Mel (Advanced Mode), which would be considered Expert difficulty.

Overall, it was somewhat interesting, but I my reaction in the end was as indifferent as when I first heard about it. If you have Portal and want more achievements, as well as more gameplay by using classic vanilla Portal with a few new mechanics, feel free. Just be aware that it's nowhere near as easy as classic Portal.

6/10 Nothing stellar. A harder Portal game by a Portal modder who loves to torture portal fans with tough maps.
 
Shrodu
773 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
2 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 dÃ©cembre 2019
AMAZING!
a must-have if portal is too easy for you.
Some of the best puzzling I've ever done, with difficulty ranging from hard to Impossibly Hard and one or more 'AHA' moments in each chamber. I was sceptical at first since the energy pellets were annoying at best in the base game, but this game elevates them to a whole new level, making them precise and fun and allowing them to interact with other elements and every inch of the level. These tests will really challenge your ability to think with portals, pellets, and more.

Visually, this game is consistent with the Portal 1 style, with a bit of it's own flare to accommodate for the pellet focused tests. The soundtrack is good, and the voice lines are generally creative and amusing. The story doesn't try for much and doesn't achieve much either besides providing an ending and general context for the chambers. I think this is perfect, we still have the portal games if we want a big story, this mod is about the tests.

Overall, I'm so glad I found this. It takes a special kind of game to make you feel like a moron one minute and a genius the next. A fantastic extension to the original Portal I grew up with.
9/10, could have been 38 chambers :)
 
Gummerfly
80 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 17 dÃ©cembre 2019
Amazing maps, it's almost a shame it's for free. They deserve some reward for their work.
I got stuck two places. One was a very silly thing (hint Glados gives some info that is crucial to solve one simple map) The other one was simply my stupidity. Other than that I solved all of them fairly easy. Significantly more challenging than normal Portal. There are bonus maps you can unlock by finding hidden places in the maps.
I noticed one panel was open and my curiosity motivated me to find out what was behind it...that's how I discovered the bonus maps.
I tend to find those energy pellets super annoying, but they are used in a way that minimizes this annoyance. Still I'm glad they used lasers in Portal 2. There are some features that the lasers don't capture though and this gives these puzzles a unique and novel aspect.
 
Calwin

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 juillet 2016
A free mod for Portal owners that's... rather difficult.

The new mechanics work well, but they can be a little confusing at first.

Some of the later puzzles are just brutal though, requiring quite a bit of knowledge about these new mechanics.

I kinda feel a bit more time to learn the systems would have helped.
 
Hudbus
566 produits enregistrÃ©s

5 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
4.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 mai 2019
It's so close.

Story and voiceacting beside, theres not really anything that makes this game portal. What made portal good isn't what made this game good, or would anyway. The focus on energy pellets makes this game an energy pellet game, not a portal game.

No interaction with other elements that made portal good in the first place is the real kicker. The only way the tests were hard were with completely arbitrary solutions based heavy on timing instead of actual puzzles, besides the first few levels.
This game perfectly showcases how replacing energy pellets with lasers in portal 2 was a good idea.

To the games credit however, the music is really good and has innovative mechanics branching off of energy pellets. Too bad that it's the only thing the game actually uses and leads to bad puzzles. There's litterally only two main mechanics: cubes and energy pellets which even the original portal had more of.

The inclusion of original portal or even completely seperate mechanics could've made this game from a 5/10 to a 9/10
 
SUPERHOT
111 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 fÃ©vrier 2015
*Spoiler Alert for the Rexaura Story*
It's a puzzle game, not a story, which I must admit disappointed me. I was all like "Okay, when does the escape begin?" ... and it didn't. But the ending definitely did have that "meta" feeling, that awesome feeling when you go through a journey to find yourself back at the start.
Enough about the "story." The two things that speak to you are just below as amusing as GLaDOS and Wheatley. The music is amazing, which automatically puts it at the level of Aperture TAG and higher ('cause let's all admit, the best part about TAG was the music).
And the puzzles... oh, the puzzles in Rexaura are amazing!...ly hard, at least on your first run. I was forced into skipping Chamber 15 -- I'll solve it later. It is tremendously satisfying to solve each test. Just like most puzzle games, replayability is massively reduced on a second run -- that said, it still has more playtime simply because of the difficulty.
A lot of the time, the mechanic in Rexaura seems to be: Hey, you can do this part THIS slowly, but that's not fast enough. So, how can you do it more efficiently? Here's a hint when such a situation arises: Stop trying to jump run and figure out it using your brain, not your feet!

Oh, and it's worth noting that Rexaura testing elements can be found in the BEE2 mod for the PTI in Portal 2.
 
Tisajokt
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 15 fÃ©vrier 2021
Rexaura is a free modification for Portal 1 which will really really put your mind to the test.

Pros:
- 20 new chambers
- New mechanics like green orbits that will only be activated via a button and cubes can be used as obstacles for the green orbit to change its direction
- Some great voice acting between levels
- The earlier chambers are relatively easy


Neutral:
- About 3-5 hours to complete or more if you don't look up any guides
- Some of these chambers seems impossible and can take you so many time that it would make you get tired of it, but I guess that's the point of the mod
- There are bonus chambers which you can unlock throughout the chambers in the form of cakes, but I don't think I'm willing to spend my time them it as the mod was frustrating enough.

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:
- I had to look up a guide so many times, because I felt like I was wasting my time.

8/10 It's a great free modification for Portal 1 and I recommend it for those who seeks extra challenges, but beware that it will frustrate you a lot and you may just open up a guide while you play.
 
Beggar Soldier

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 mars 2015
This game blow my mind. Praise Allah.

It like Portal where you shoot orange and blue circles but also have new puzzle. I notice less jumping which didn't make me so motion sick like riding camel over many dunes.

Puzzles are much better than Portal but Portal has better story. Choosing between Portal or Rexaura feels like choosing between two sisters. Rexaura is probably not the better looking sister and possibly slightly annoying voice but give you harder experience. Everyone had Portal anyway.

Red
88 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
11.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 juin 2016
I held off playing Rexaura because my past experiences playing Portal 1 mods have been a punishing endeavor (I'm looking at you Portal: Prelude). Then I thought to myself this is Mevious, the best Portal 2 mapper out there (the Portal 2 workshop)! I then played Rexaura. Yes! It's not a punishing Portal 1 mod! All the puzzles can be solved casually because they are all logical tests instead of ninja reflex or "get murdered a bunch of times before you finally survive" tests. I highly recommend this mod! Mevious did a good job creating the tests in a cohesive order. He also did a good job working within Portal 1 limitations as Portal 2 is better optimized as it feels better to control. This mod is just puzzles.

There is dialog, but not much of a story. If you are looking for a custom story, you are out of luck. Doesn't bother me because it's hard to create a decent story that a lot of people can enjoy and not feel too annoyed by. Also a lot of other mods tend to repeat the Portal 1 tutorial storyline but in terrible ways. Rexaura doesn't do this, excluding the mono-portal and dual-portal device retrieval. The rest feels like an extension of Portal 1. It is moderately difficult. Novice players will probably be occupied for hours on end while more advanced players will finish within a few hours.
 
wildgoosespeeder

I do not recommend playing this.

8.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 juin 2016
Excellent mod, definitely more difficult than basic chambers on Portal (something players were asking for, as I remember). It still maintains the original ironic/sarcastic mood of testers, but now you have two of them. Some key and brilliant elements are missing, but the excellent design of chambers and of the screenplay make it enjoyable. Only, be ready with YouTube, as 19 chambers are many, and some quite challenging. You may need some walkthrough not to get stuck.

Ğ’ĞµÑÑ‘Ğ»Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ¸Ğ½Ñ‚ĞµÑ€ĞµÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğµ, Ğ±Ñ€Ğ¾ÑĞ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ² ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸, ÑĞ¾Ñ…Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ñ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´ÑƒÑ… Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Portal, Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ·Ñ‹ĞºĞ°, Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğµ ÑĞ»ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½Ñ‚Ñ‹ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğº, Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ñ‡ĞµĞ»Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¶. Ğ’ÑÑ‘ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ² ÑÑƒĞ¼Ğ¼Ğµ Ğ´Ğ°Ñ‘Ñ‚ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ Ğº Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ³Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğµ. Ğ•ÑĞ»Ğ¸ Ğ²Ñ‹ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğµ Portal Ğ¸ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¸ Ğ² Rexaura -- ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ‚Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑĞºĞ¾Ñ€ĞµĞµ.

P.S. Ğ Ğ°Ğ·Ñ€Ğ°Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğº ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚, Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑĞ·Ñ‹Ğº Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ñ€ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ±Ñ‹ Ñ ÑƒĞ´Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ» Ğ² Rexaura ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·, Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ² Portal 2. Ğ ĞµÑ‰Ñ‘ Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµ -- Ğ² ÑĞ¸ĞºĞ²ĞµĞ», ÑĞ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ° Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Portal 2.
 
Lea
0
32 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
4 personnes ont trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
Non recommandÃ©
5.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 19 dÃ©cembre 2014
Why does everything that mimics Portal fail to capture it's acrobatic, 'freedom of movement' spirit? Even Portal 2 was guilty of this. You see, Portal 1 had special walls that you could NOT shoot portals onto, while Portal 2 has special walls that you CAN shoot portals onto. Similarly, Portal was a game all about a portalgun, and things like boxes, energy pellets and moving platforms were passively thrown in. But Rexaura is a mod all about energy pellets with a portalgun passively thrown in. The portalgun ends up being just a glorified garage door opener.

To understand why that's a bad thing, we need to understand another subtle difference between Portal and Portal 2. The series's evolutionary process decided lasers were better than energy pellets so the energy pellets were removed but still existed, in spirit, as lasers. In other words, lasers became the new energy pellets. Energy pellets and lasers are not bad game mechanics. But what is bad is how they're used. You can't throw a dart at the Portal 2 workshop without hitting a page with a laser test on it and, spoiler warning, THEY ALL SUCK. They're a creative shorthand for "I started off making a test but then I realized I had no clear goal, so here's a laser test instead." From the creative perspective, they're lazy. From the player's perspective, they're boring. And from the community's perspective, they're the scum of the workshop.

If you've been paying attention then you should already know where this is going. But just in case you haven't: If energy pellet tests are equivalent to modern day boring uninspired laser tests and Rexaura is nothing but energy pellet tests, then guess what Rexaura is. Yep. That.

To it's credit, Rexaura makes a genuine effort to be more than a collection of boring laser tests. It introduces a lot of custom made mechanics for interacting with energy pellets, adding multiple layers of mind boggling complexity. It forces you to be creative and think five steps ahead at all times. It goes out of it's way to create an environment that's all it's own without compromising Portal's. As far as boring laser tests go, it truly raises the bar, goes above and beyond and should be commended. But, sadly, no matter how polished a collection of laser tests is, it's still just a collection of boring laser tests.

It's a shame, really. Rexaura's intentions were clearly in the right place. It had spunk. It had moxy. It had gumption. If only it had more variety to it's tests. If only there were any tests with acrobatic, high flying, portal flinging fun to help break up the monotony of the boring laser tests then this would be a real winner. It could have been worthy of the title, "The true sequel to Portal". Rexaura could have been a real asset to the gaming universe. It could have grown up to become a doctor or an astronaut or even the president. I'm not mad at Rexaura, I'm just disappointed with the path it has chosen in life.

I simply can't recommend Rexaura and I hate myself for it. May god have mercy on my soul.
 
ğŸ­
781 produits enregistrÃ©s
9

153 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
10.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 dÃ©cembre 2014
Whilst Rexaura has very good puzzle design, it is honestly the worst Portal mod I have ever played. This mod was hyped up so much that I expected proper voice acting at least.

The story was pretty boring, in all honestly. I expected a proper ending where I could at least fight for my life, rather than just be dumped into the void. It's such a pity, because Rexaura introduced such amazing concepts but then puty them to such a poor use.

Despite this, I still recommend playing through this mod, as it is free. But don't expect to be blown away by it.

Equatius-Kon
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
5.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 septembre 2019
I beat Rexaura and got all the achievements. Ultimately it's like Portal 1 except unintuitive and less fun in every way. It's a well made game however and whilst it was a complete slog it did have its moments. The antagonist is surprisingly good and the levels are certainly creative (if tough and drawn-out). I can only recommend you play it if you're desperate to play more Portal content, otherwise you should avoid.
 
Sultan of Sequencing
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 novembre 2019
I recommend you to play this only if:
You are desperately seeking some portal action
OR
You are madly in love with power pellates. Because this mod only has tests about them.

If you are looking for the story... There is none. The ending just happens, not even an escape sequence thrown in. The dialogue can be funny, but overall still pretty meh.

It's kinda good overall, and puzzles are not that stupidly unintuitive and hard as in, for example, Portal: Prelude (definetely don't play that one), so giving Rexaura a try won't hurt.
 
Lemonov
443 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
109.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 dÃ©cembre 2020
Excellent sequel to the original Portal (using the Energy Pellet, which was retired in Portal 2 and Portal Stories Mel in favour of the Laser). Some of the Test Chambers are quite tough, and require good spatial geometry visualisation to solve.

Only puzzle I didn't like was the hidden room in Test Chamber 14. Placing the portals to gain access to the Button (which opens the secret room), means the Energy Pellet is no longer in Stasis, which means it SHOULD be destroyed, which means a new Pellet will be created, which will destroy the Cube holding the Door open, which means you can't get back to the hidden room and the cake. However, the pellet isn't destroyed, which it should be, (illogical) - hence my dislike of this puzzle.

ĞŸĞ»ÑÑÑ‹:

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
3.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 avril 2016
Rexaura is a mixed bag. At first, I liked it because it added some new elements and provided good challenges. However, many of the levels were so confusing that I found myself frequently checking walkthrough videos on YouTube to complete (something I never did in the original Portal games). Also, a few levels seemed to be much more a matter of timing and speed than actually solving a puzzle. Lastly, the focus on energy pellets in every level got a bit repetitive by the end. I kinda wish this was released as a series of Portal 2 community chambers so that I could just skip the levels that were annoying.
 
GOB
1,546 produits enregistrÃ©s

1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
4.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 septembre 2021
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

There are almost no difficult puzzles in this mod, after solving which you will consider yourself a superintelligence, except for the last two, probably. Basically, all 1-17 chambers are completed in 5-10 minutes, the other 2 in 20-30. But, the fact that I really did not like that everything here is based on TIMING, practically no need to think. The plot does not arouse any interest here, but it can be forgiven, because this is just a mod.

In general, for me, an absolutely uninteresting mod, in which everything is based on timings. But I advise you to play this mod at least for the last two chambers. And of course try to get into the secret passage in 14 chambers!))) It will be fun :)
 
Frorr

Non recommandÃ©
4.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 10 septembre 2015
(DISCLAIMER: I have not yet finished Rexaura. This review is based what I've experienced so far.)

The puzzles are good and challenging, but the mod lacks personality. 1.Theres no story, so you're just left solving test chamber after test chamber with no over all goal. 2. The characters are boring, they tell jokes, but it just feels like they're reading off a script instead of talking to you.

So far this mod is just a "meh" for me.



(Ok, I just looked up the ending on youtube and it doesn't get better.)
 
Jrockten

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 28 mai 2015
Fun mod, very original story, using the energy pellets, which is cool, and tying it into the story of the original Portal and how GLaDOS is not there. Overall 9/10 just for some stuff thats a bit confusing in a few of the tests. So yeah, original, fun, ties into the canon timeline.

Non recommandÃ©
1.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 mars 2022
This mod is 100% execution-based puzzles using energy pellets, because apparently, that's the only thing that the developers know how to make. At least that's what it is as far as I can tell, because I'm not playing this anymore. Needs more variety in terms of the types of puzzles. And execution-based puzzles are inherently bad, especially since most of the puzzles in this mod (that I have completed) have you racing the energy pellet.
 
TChapman500

¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸ªà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¸ªà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ˆà¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‹à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹‡à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¸±à¹Œà¹à¹Œà¹ Look, it's decent, but not good. The puzzles ain't that good and they're centered around waiting and making millisecond-perfect moves that don't reuire you to think but just to waste your time trough try and error.

Play the first levels and bail out when the puzzles go multi-room, like, with a lot of purple lightings.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 31 octobre 2023
The level of difficulty is perfect for people who want more Portal but not stuff so hardcore that you spend days trying to figure it out. It gets challenging but in a way that is not overwhelming. The solutions are satisfying to find and only the last 3 rooms really make you stop for a good while. Greatly appreciated.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 juin 2017
Not bad, but just really repetitive.
This game reuses the same two mechanics over and over again! The pellet gun and cube placement.
There is no enjoyment to be had, when I solved a puzzle I felt more frustrated than anything else.
Ended giving up 2/3 of the ways through.
Don't recommend unless you like frustrating puzzles and don't mind reused mechanics.

Non recommandÃ©
10.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 juillet 2021
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

I have been enjoying the game, although the AI interacting with you ended up making a joke that was sexual in nature. The witty sarcasm is quite funny, but I'm not a fan of dirty jokes, and wish that had been left out. I am hoping there aren't anymore, especially since there doesn't seem to be any self-declaration of such content in the game's description. Portal 2 and Portal Reloaded seem to keep the jokes clean. In general the puzzles have been great so far. They've got the Portal feel, and the epiphany moments are great as you figure things out.
 
Vargose
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
0.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 3 dÃ©cembre 2019
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

This is my first negative review since my old Cry of Fear review, but well, here we go.

I honestly do not think this mod is good. Being the only Portal specific mod for the first one, I am APPAULED at how they wasted it with this. High energy pellet testing being the main gimmick is not good, due to how they work. Green pellet orbs that explode when you step off of a button is bad gameplay design, and reflection ain't good either. Random corpses scattered around do not fit within the clean environment with no signs of anything bad happening(office areas could work, but in a test chamber, especially when it uses a model from HL2, nope).

Finally, this tries putting humour like Portal 2 did, only difference is that 2 succeeded, this failed. "Thanks, Wikipedia" isn't funny, especially with Wiki's scummy practices(I don't wanna get doxxed because I edited an article without an account). This is done from Text to speech voices( at least it sounds like), which makes it worse, Blue Portals and Prelude used TTS way better because Humans all have different ones(Prelude) and in BP the AI is the only one talking. Having 2 TTS AI's talk with eachother is a dealbreaker for me.

Intro cutscene is nice tho.

Overall, 1/10
 
I've ran out of profile ideas h

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
41.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 dÃ©cembre 2014
Rexaura is a mod for Portal 1. It expands the energy pellets from the first game into more mechanics. The creator of the mod is quite infamous on the community for his daunting puzzles, and some endgame chambers can be quite difficult or maybe even impossible. Even if you don't manage to complete the mod, it's fine as you'll have a grand sense of accomplishment even if you reach that part. The only downside is the waiting since we're dealing with energy pellets.

If you want a big challenge and loved portal 1, this mod is for you.
 
_galaxy
4

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
8.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 janvier
Wow, i'm really impressed with this mod! This is probably the most challenging mod i've ever played of Portal (almost went insane on some of the final chambers) and overall I liked it pretty much. I don't really like the energy palettes in general, so playing a whole mod with a focus on especially that wasn't going to be a walk in the park for me, but it wasn't that hard to get into it though. I don't like the fact that this mod relies so heavily on timing (something I always tend to mess up) and having to create solutions with that in mind was not something I was used to. The new features added were pretty interesting, the narrative is interesting, though the ending was underwhelming, it still had some funny dialogues.

Overall, I really recomend you to play this mod - it is a difficult one for sure, but it is pretty well made. Props for the development team.
 
matt

Fantastic custom Portal Campaign. Incredible Puzzle design focusing only on high-energy pellets. The story is more just added flavor, there's not exactly much going on and the narrator is more annoying than funny, but it doesn't detract from the really satisfying puzzles.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 novembre 2023
Same as Portal Stories: Mel, this mod is much better, and it much improves upon the original Portal by miles.

Same as Portal Stories: Mel, this mod has some not-so-great puzzles, some great puzzles, and some puzzles which are actually phenomenal.

Different though to Portal Stories: Mel, there is less emphasis on story (this is a good thing in this case), and there is more emphasis on puzzles. As mentioned before, the puzzle quality is not always there, there a re numerous puzzles one can cheese through, and the puzzle design is a little bit one-dimensional, since it only revolves around pellets. However, some puzzles are masterfully done, much improving from both puzzle designs of Portal and Portal 2.

It's great that the community basically took the 2 games and turned them into something else. More people should play these Portal and Portal 2 mods, they are really great and much better than the originals.
 
romas-92

RecommandÃ©
3.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 octobre 2023
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Alright. This one is a tough decision. First of all, it's a **free** Portal mod, new elements are introduced as well as new gameplay mechanics, new story and new achievements. This mod is built around energy pellets, which are present in every chamber and there is not much else. The puzzles are kinda hard compared to portal but still doable. Some people may consider this mod boring and repetitive and because of that I recommend playing this game with a friend.
At the end of the day, its a free, challenging portal mod you definitely should try out!

theveryepicdude
25 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
Non recommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 septembre 2023
Is this game good?
In short:
I think this fangame tries too hard and it doesn't achieve any of the positives or attractiveness that Portal actually had. Even if it comes strong with new concepts and a ton of original dialogue.

In long:
When you start playing you feel like it has interesting ideas like the use of green energy pellets (which weren't used by the first game much, except like once) and a ton of new original objects and concepts, such as obstacles that destroy the pellets (and blocks), barriers that activate things, or cube holders for easier pathing. It even adds a new core character who's pretty robotic and tries to guide you, trying to present itself as truthful, supportive and informative, which creates a fun dynamic along GLaDOS, who's rather bored and insulting.

But that's pretty much it. The game makes no much use of the rest of mechanics that the game has to offer and you'll find yourself doing the same repetitive tasks of finding a way to make the annoying pellets hit a barrier or an activator at the correct time. It's 19 levels of the same thing, and it never bothers about trying to add any variety. Only thing it does is repeating the same concepts in bigger rooms with a lot of the past mentioned objects all around the place, making you lose time intentionally to have you playing more. Because the game doesn't even use turrets or much jumping around, almost never using the momentum mechanics and making the movement be rather boring.

But besides the lack of good puzzling and dull mechanics, the dialogue starts to feel even worse when the only thing that could be considered a story or context in its own world (such as trying to use the pellets to provide energy to the facility) is dismantled by GLaDOS (revealing that this is actually fake), and then the rest of her dialogues represent the boredom of the puzzles (as she herself says, they're just too repetitive).

Only good part of going through this was getting the unlockables (hidden cake) which only gives us bonus maps (more suffering! yay!) and wanting to check what was the so mentioned "Surprise" that GLaDOS was hiding for us.

But, spoilers ahead:
It was nothing. It was the least expected thing: just killing the protagonist and... Nothing else. No escape sequence, no fight, not even encountering a turret nor anything. The game just ends after it kills you. Imagine if there was no escape sequence and almost no use of the funny game mechanics on portal 1 besides the energy pellets, and this would be it.

What else is there to say? You can tell they really tried, but it was made by someone who didn't understand what made Portal be a good game at all.
 
Sairusa
0

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 aout 2023
Como tremendo speedrunner que soy, he completado Rexaura en 1 dÃ­a y puedo decir que es el DLC soÃ±ado para Portal 1. Solo que hecho por la comunidad y gratis. Rexaura es un mod increÃ­ble. Lleva la sencillez del primer Portal a niveles mÃ¡s imaginativos que los que tenÃ­a la obra de Valve. Empecemos ya.

jugablemente, es sublime. Si te flipÃ³ Portal, un mod mÃ¡s para tu lista. Es literalmente la esencia de Portal. Si que es verdad que la pistola de portales te la dan a la mitad, pero eso permite que tengas dos formas de pensar en el juego y eso me ha encantado. AdemÃ¡s del magnÃ­fico y bastante complicado diseÃ±o de puzzles que requieren de tu 100% de capacidad cerebral (mod no apto para personas â™¥â™¥â™¥ pocas neuronas) pero muy satisfactorios de encontrar la soluciÃ³n y de aplicarla. A eso se le aÃ±aden un par de mecÃ¡nicas nuevas (que los cubos desvÃ­en proyectiles, el pilar â™¥â™¥â™¥ el "agujero negro" y alguna cosa mÃ¡s) que hacen que la experiencia sea mÃ¡s fresca y divertida.

Visualmente, pues es Portal. DiseÃ±o muy limpio de salas (como si de un laboratorio se tratase) y una armonÃ­a visual que hace un estilo visual muy minimalista y funcional. Aunque no hay casi banda sonora, cosa que me ha extraÃ±ado y que he echado de menos en el mod (teniendo en cuenta que otros tienen OST â™¥â™¥â™¥ muchas canciones)

Narrativamente es bueno, aunque donde mÃ¡s brilla es en el final. Si bien no tiene nada de 10, los dos personajes al estilo Gla2 tienen un humor muy bueno y que hace reÃ­r en muchas ocasiones. Pero, no hay motivos para estar ahÃ­, aunque eso te lo explica el final, que quiero que lo descubrÃ¡is vosotros mismos.

En conclusiÃ³n, Rexaura es otro pedacito que puede aÃ±adirse al gran Portal y que si te gusta esta saga, deberÃ­as jugar para tener todavÃ­a mÃ¡s puzzles en Aperture Science. RecomendadÃ­simo

Crazy Cosmos
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juillet 2023
It's a pretty good mod if you're looking for some more portal. The puzzles are based around the energy balls and so quite a few chambers require good timing to make things work. The last 2 chambers were really tough, but overall I found this to be very enjoyable. It's about 3 hours long, and it's free so a fun addition if you enjoyed the main portal game and want more puzzles to complete.

A really nice Portal mod with a unique, cold and distant soundtrack. The use of energy pellets in test chambers is excellent, since I was missing energy pellets in Portal 2. My only gripe is that the cake achievement is a little broken.

77777777777777777777777777777
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 avril 2023
Positive aspects:
- puzzles were challenging, just as promised;
- contains new gameplay elements;
- has an awesome soundtrack;
- contains bonus content;
- no bugs;

Negative aspects:
- puzzles seemed a bit repetitive at times, with high energy pellets being the main element in almost every chamber;
- little to no story, inaccurate characrterization of GLaDOS (her voice audio was life-less too);

All in all, worth a try if you're here for the puzzles, not the story. Good mod!

Mateus
18 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
0.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 mars 2023
rexaura is a pellet-themed portal mod.

if you didn't like the pellet mechanics in portal1, you will not like rexaura. it is ENTIRELY based around pellets. they are not just a "focus" of rexaura, they ARE rexaura.

the game plays great. it looks exactly like portal 1, obviously, and adds some positively mindf/ck-inducing challenges. they add various new types of pellets and elements to interact with these pellets.

there's also 20, decently lengthy, levels to get through. And it's FREE.

This is probably one of the most entertaining Portal mods of all time, not to mention one of the most creative. In this mod, Mevious uses mechanics from Portal to create even more fleshed-out puzzles than any of the official games.

michelangelo profile award
272 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 janvier 2023
A short, moderately challenging mod that adds depth to an underutilized and uninteresting mechanic from the first Portal game (energy pellets).

The puzzles are certainly more difficult than the original Portal but, with the exception of one bonus puzzle, I did not consider any of the puzzles to be "challenging". Many were tricky and all were well-designed, but I did not find myself stumped by the puzzles in the same way that Portal: Reloaded stumped me. Players who have only played the campaigns of Portal 1 and Portal 2 will probably find these maps a lot more difficult though.

The custom story/dialogue in the game is just... fine? Most of the humor didn't land and, though I appreciate the developer's attempt at re-creating the wit and sarcasm of the original game, I found several of the lines rather cringey. For the most part, I ignored the dialogue. That said, a few of the jokes did make me laugh and there is occasionally some well-written dialogue and I appreciated the game's ending.

Regardless of its flaws, I had fun playing through Rexaura and it is always satisfying to scratch that testing itch.
 
Luthanicus

70 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 dÃ©cembre 2022
Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Rexaura is a free mod for Portal, which itself is a classic. This mod is heavily based around the Energy Pellets from the base game, as well as a new variant added by the mod, and how they move around in the world with portals.

There's some real headscractchers in this one. I had to get a guide to get past Chamber 12, but once you see the solution there's always that "OHHH" moment, as promised. Definitely worth the time to play it.
 
nictheman123

Produit reÃ§u gratuitement

Mayor Awesomeyeah 876
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation amusante
0
RecommandÃ©
3.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 novembre 2022
There's no story in this mod, nor is there an exhilarating final act where you rush through the depths of a science facility and battle a giant robot, but the puzzles in this mod are stellar. They're what the original Portal should've been.

Portal disappointed me because it was so short. The game baby-sits you for the first half of its campaign with boringly easy puzzles because the developers feel nervous that you won't understand its portal mechanic. This mod treats the player like they're smart and wastes no time throwing punishingly difficult puzzles at the player. Each level took me at least 10 minutes to figure out. They have all fantastically clever, logical, and sequential solutions that feel really satisfying to find. I always felt excited for whatever was next once I solved each puzzle. To me, that's the mark of a good puzzle game.
 
~ Georgio ~
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
18.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 octobre 2022
This is probably one of the best mods for the portal series I played, and definitely best for Portal 1. The chambers are really difficult, but the solutions are easy to execute which is great. I like how this mod took the simple concept of energy pellets and upgraded it. On top of that, the custom voicelines for GLaDOS and the Encouragement Core sound really well and often gave me a good laugh. The mod kinda lacks a story, but personally I care about the chambers more. 10/10

Sadly the story wasn't too engaging, so I only recommend this mod for the extra test chambers with some new mechanics.

A great mod, it adds in a lot of new content not seen in official games. Also it's very hard, I had to think for a while on some of the later ones and also had to look up a hint for 17. I wouldn't recommend this to a new Portal player but if you're experienced, you should try this even if you don't finish it

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 31 aout 2022
it was good

the only bad things I have to say about it was that jumping made you move faster but my headphones gave off a small ultrasonic high pitch every time the character landed and because the character moved slow it was faster to bunnyhop everywhere (I never had a problem with that in the other portal games)

on one level the way it would orient the screen after falling through a portal felt wonky and I swear it even switched the way it oriented itself when placing the portals in the exact same orientations which was frustrating

one time I placed a portal and appeared out of a wall across the map where there was no portal

I had trouble understanding what the voice actors were saying because of the heavy voice modification so I put on closed captions to see it

other than that I enjoyed the puzzles and as long as you have portal 2 its free

0
RecommandÃ©
3.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 6 aout 2022
This game was obtained from Steam via Product Activation

While being a relatively short game it introduces some interesting mechanics that weren't in the original portal. Some of the puzzle's were a bit frustrating to solve after you've solved them it does make sense and doesn't feel like they were unfair, just challenging.

The story could be better but it was good enough to stay engaged. The story takes place between portal 1 and portal 2 so I'd highly recommend finishing the first portal game first as it does help make the story make a bit more sense but it isn't required and works well as an independent game.

BiggsHoson
304 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 12 novembre 2021
The puzzle doesn't require any tricks, just logical thinking. (That also means the solution are less surprising when you figured it out. )
The solution are easy to do, you don't have to shot portal while doing infinite loop like in Mel's story.
The difficulty is lower than both Mel's story and Portal:Reload, it should be fun even for amateur.
The length of each level won't be too long, you don't have to calculate like 5 steps ahead.

It's a very good Portal mod. Most of the puzzles are based around energy pellets but unlike the original Portal in which the energy pellets were somewhat a pain in the ass these puzzles are very well designed.
It adds some new mechanics like energy pellets destroyers and Cube placers to redirect the pellets that are a great help.

RecommandÃ©
5.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 1 juin 2021
This is maybe one of my favourite Portal mods. While I'm not a huge fan of the writing and text-to-speech, it does exactly what I'm looking for when it comes to Portal mods, which is new testing elements in the individual chambers, rather than changing or adding to the portal gun.

The puzzles are well thought out, and the new elements added build well off of the mechanics put in place in Portal 1. 100% recommend.

RecommandÃ©
15.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 14 mai 2021
Rough around the edges with infrequent moments where the ever-present energy pellets will bounce off something in a way that is obviously not intended.
Otherwise this is a fun and delightfully challenging bit of extra portal that makes you think outside the box for it's puzzles.
And hey, its free (if you have portal. but you wouldn't be playing this if you didn't want more portal now would you)
 
Starry_Feathers
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 5 mai 2021
The puzzles were good, I enjoyed them. They were difficult, but not overly difficult, and I enjoyed the logic employed. I also liked the additions to the game, with brand new puzzle bits and everything.

The story itself was alright. Personally I found it a little boring and actually kind of annoying, but it worked and fit in with the rest of the portal games.

Voice acting was good, I liked it, although quite often the woman's voice couldn't really be heard over the music and background noise. This lead to me being a little confused as to what was going on at the end, but I figured it out.

Overall, yeah, a good game. If you are desperate for new more puzzles, then go ahead. And if you ever thought energy pellets were under utilised, then this is the portal game for you.

Portal 1 e Portal 2 sÃ£o Ã³timos jogos. Magistrais em tudo: uma histÃ³ria bem contada, design de fases muito bem planejado sendo que a Valve vai guiando sutilmente o jogador na resoluÃ§Ã£o de puzzles , dificuldade gradativa conforme o jogador vai passando de fase e tempo de jogo. A Valve fez tudo na medida certa e acho que dificilmente uma outra empresa faria tudo na medida certa.

Mas e esse mod "Rexaura"?

Ele Ã© simplesmente DIFÃCIL (depois de 6 fases ele fica REALMENTE DIFÃCIL) ele atÃ© adiciona algumas mecÃ¢nicas mas nÃ£o Ã© algo suficiente que prenda o jogador. Rexaura nÃ£o Ã© um jogo que se compare com portal. Eu diria que a mecÃ¢nica predominante que existe nesse jogo Ã© a bola de energia, que Ã© algo que envelheceu muito mal com tempo; prova disso Ã© a troca das bolas de energia pelos lasers em portal 2.

Resumindo, o que Ã© "Rexaura"?

Um mod de Portal 1 com Puzzles que vÃ£o ficando EXTREMAMENTE difÃ­ceis com o passar das fases (vocÃª provavelmente olharÃ¡ como passar as fases no youtube, algo que nunca me vi fazendo nos jogos originais), junto com a mecÃ¢nica ultrapassada das bolas de energia e com um final DECEPCIONANTE. Rexaura atÃ© adiciona algumas mecÃ¢nicas novas, mas nada que realmente seja interessante. Ele Ã© um "mod" de Portal mas nÃ£o Ã© uma "ExperiÃªncia digna" de Portal.

Se vocÃª quer outros "mods" que sejam dignos de uma "experiÃªncia" portal eu diria dois que existem aqui mesmo na Steam:
1) Aperture Tag: The Paint Gun Testing Initiative;
2) Portal Stories: Mel

SÃ³ por curiosidade: "Rexaura" Ã© a sequÃªncia de outro mod chamado "portal pro" que foi feito pelo mesmo criador. "Portal Pro" tambÃ©m nÃ£o Ã© um jogo bom.

Zorgano
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.8 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 13 fÃ©vrier 2021
Slightly longer than the original game but just as fun, Rexaura is an exploration of an underutilized mechanic of the original Portal, the high energy pellet, which was replaced with lasers in Portal 2. Rexaura adds a bunch of new chamber elements to create fascinating timing puzzles that wouldn't be possible in Portal 2. It's free so you might as well download it for a couple hours of gameplay.

Ğ¡ÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğ° Ğ½ĞµÑ‚. Ğ Ğ¾Ğ½ Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ½ÑƒĞ¶ĞµĞ½, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¼ĞºĞ° Ğ²ĞµĞ´ÑŒ.

DmitrySukhoy
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 octobre 2020
This is, ultimately, a positive review, but far less positive than it could've been.

I love Mevious. I love Portal Pro and I also love his Portal 2 workshop maps. Yet playing Rexaura eventually left me feeling tired, as if the mod was overstaying its welcome. That felt really surprising to me - each map is genuinely great, the solution tricks are all varied, yet something was amiss. Especially given that I started forgetting some of the earlier maps. That never happened to me in Portal Pro.

The problem is that while the solutions are varied, the obstacles are far less so - this is an energy ball mod in which you use portals to connect two seemingly unconnectable places. On every single level. Individually, each map is perfectly adorable, but when you put them all together, the last quarter of the game can feel like a slog. It's one of the mods you need to play inbetween something else to keep things fresh and varied. Binging Rexaura is a bad idea.

Other aspects are underused, even though they didn't have to be - for instance, there's very little flinging in this mod. Why? Who knows. It's not like you can't combine energy balls and flinging...

I was also disappointed by the writing - granted, Portal Pro's writing wasn't amazing, either, but Rexaura's felt like a step backwards. It tries so hard to have Portal's dark humor, but falls so short. Portal Pro's take on GLaDOS was merely meh. Rexaura's was, at times, actively annoying. This isn't helped by the fact that there's just more dialogue in general, which also means more bad dialogue. (OK, I did like the monkey quip and the ending, while a bit anticlimactic, is very, very clever.)

And yet... and yet this is a mod you shouldn't miss, because Mevious at his meh is still better than a lot of designers at their best. Each map (after the first few tutorial-ish ones, I guess) offers genuine "a-ha" moments that you, as the player, have to earn by genuine thinking. You cannot just go into a room and do stuff like you did in the original game, every puzzle requires thinking by several steps ahead. The mod also adds some new or uncommon mechanics -- cube holders for easy reflections, pellets activated by buttons, great uses of perpetual pellets... Difficult timing isn't required, either, although it is sometimes helpful. ;) One thing that's definitely an upgrade over Portal Pro is that it's no longer so easy to break puzzles with portal peeking - Pro pretty much depended on your "good faith" to not do that. In Rexaura, peeks are rarely all that helpful.

The bonus chambers vary in quality, but the cakes are in more sane places this time around. Portal Pro's cakes had some real BS hiding places, Rexaura has less of that. Currently only advanced 9 is remaining (out of everything in this mod) and I certainly did enjoy it... I just wish it had more variety to make playing a lot of it at once less tiring and I wish the writing was better. The variety issue is the main problem, though. I do not recommend binging Rexaura, but I certainly recommend playing it. It could've been better, but it's still a great mod. Favorite chamber: 15.

(Also: lovely ambient music, and a step up from the already good music of Portal Pro, although on a per-track basis, "Sin" is still Mevious' best track, IMO)
 
Muzozavr
0

If you are a lover of portal and you want more challenging puzzles on top of comedy in the same spirit of portal 2's, then this is a must-install. The game is genuinely difficult, and are in the same vain as the original puzzles. Expect a lot of orb puzzles mixed with emancipation grids. It even adds to the original's mechanics, with the green orbs and purple... thingys. Just get it man!

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 4 septembre 2020
Out of all of the Portal and Portal 2 mods that I've played (and I've played a good bunch of them), this is by far the best one. Most mods I've played feel like cheap imitation portal, but Rexaura doesn't feel that way so much.

In this game, I really enjoyed:
-The humor
-The soundtrack. Intro music is pretty epic.
-Not too long to play

My only complaint is there isn't much plot, and the ending is not very creative and rather anticlimactic.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.2 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 23 juillet 2020
A confusing, challenging Portal mod that I absolutely love. Its concepts are unique and enjoyable to work with, and make for interesting puzzles. If you think you're good at figuring out Portal puzzles made by the community and/or from the community's mods, then you haven't seen anything until you've played this.
 
soapmakestunes
107 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
1 personne a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
15.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juillet 2020
One of the best portal mods gameplay-wise. Plenty of ah-ha moments while solving the puzzles. The game puts heavy emphasis on energy pellets and adds many new pellet-based game elements. This does mean timing is required for some chambers, but for the most part the mod focuses on the logical side of energy pellets. The game does this by introducing a new green energy pellet that remains as long as it is being powered by a cube on a button. It is definitely harder than the two original portal games so get ready for a challenge. It also gives off a distinct portal 1 vibe that none of the other mods really have. It just feels like more portal 1. Similarly to portal 1 the game doesn't try to do much story-wise, but uses entertaining dialogue instead. So give the game a try. It is free after all.
 
LextheMighty
385 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
8.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 11 juillet 2020
This is a very good mod. If it weren't for the text-to-speech GLaDOS and Encouragement Core voices I wouldn't be able to tell this wasn't designed by Valve themselves. The concepts used are taught pretty well.

Chamber 16 could have used some work on the flinging section, as I found myself needing to quickload often because going through the angled panel makes the camera compensate weirdly, making it difficult to aim at the floor in time.

Chamber 14's secret cake was also a very interesting challenge, and easily the hardest part of the whole mod.

All in all, very good mod, and a must-play for all Portal owners.
 
darkerbit

RecommandÃ©
3.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 juin 2020
A very fun puzzle game that had me stumped quite often with surprisingly simple yet deceptive test chambers. My only issue is a lack of an escape sequence since that's such a trademark of Portal, but maybe there are some secrets I missed. Loved the soundtrack as well. If you want a good challenge, give Rexaura a shot.

I spent a lot of long hours trying to solve the puzzles the game has.
But I don't recall a lot of games where I was satisfied when finishing one particular chapter or level, whatever you call it.
Without any doubt, I'd recommend this game to anyone who loves the games like that. You'll get a lot of pleasure playing it. At least I did.
 
AntohaN8
83 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
25.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 mai 2020
"If you have a history of seizures or epilepsy, please refrain from looking directly at the Aperture Hydromagnetic Stability Units. If you do not have a history of seizures or epilepsy, then you're in for a treat."

This mod is about GLaDOS making you solve energy pellet tests to power the facility while berating you the whole damn way. The new mechanics the mod introduces are flexible yet easy to understand, while fitting in stylistically. The puzzles are sometimes a bit to hard, though, and I was quite tempted to look up a walkthrough several times. As for the rest of the game, the visual aesthetic is distinctly different from Portal 1, with environments being much more dark and jagged, and more glowing red exposed from windows and the backs of panels. The soundtrack is top-notch and fits the game perfectly, and I love how, despite lacking voice actors (instead using TTS programs for the characters), the mod does a great job of capturing Portal's gallows humor, although the ending leaves something to be desired. If you think you have a grip on Portal's mechanics, I recommend this tough-as-heck mod!
 
Mic Row Ave

Portal 2 King

RecommandÃ©
9.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 9 aout 2019
This mod/game have made me appreciate the first portal game a bit more due to showing how much potential the energy pellets have. The first mention of energy pellets based test chambers most likely will leave a lot of people cautious of trying this game but trust me that the makers behind this game made great puzzles around such a concept. The puzzles are very well crafted as it give that satisfying feeling when you figure out a chamber. The difficulty isn't too hard but certainly picks up at the game progresses as it should.

Ğ¡Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ ÑƒÑĞ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‘Ğ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑƒÑ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸ Ñ Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²sĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¼ĞµÑ…Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ·Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ÑÑÑ‚ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ ÑĞ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ĞµĞµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ²Ğ¾ Ğ² Ğ²Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ»Ğµ, Ğ½Ğµ Ğ³Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ ÑƒĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ¾Ğ¼. Mamin-Sibiryak
169 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 septembre 2018
My brain hurts.

These are excellent puzzles that fit the Portal universe very nicely. They actually hurt my brain a lot and I needed to take a break to write this review because thinking much harder than I usually have to in video games is really demanding. That isn't to say that I'm an idiot, okay, I'm just saying that the puzzles here are way more difficult than games tend to be. It's several steps above the original Portal games in several respects. I plowed through the first one blind in 90 minutes [minus the time I lost from dying to turrets and neurotoxin (because I wanted to see what happened)], and the second one blind in a couple of hours only running into trouble once I hit the underground levels with the gels. But for the most part, each individual puzzle was a breeze. I didn't even have trouble with the challenge maps or final levels and it was honestly a little disappointing. However, EVERY SINGLE CHAMBER in this one had me thinking for a spell on it before figuring out the right answer, and then I had to think on it for a little while longer to figure out how to go about accomplishing it. They're all just masterfully crafted though, and once you know the solution it's incredibly easy. Just use every skill you obtained from the original games and then add a pinch of extras on top of it and maybe pop some ibuprofens.

Ignore the whining in the reviews. "The text to speech robot is annoying" it literally sounds almost exactly like the originals except glados is slightly british. "The dialogue is boring and not funny" it's excrutiatingly dry and dark humor, maybe you just didn't get it. "I had to cheat just to advance" THEN GIT GUD SCRUBLORD. Yeah, there's some timing involved in doing the puzzles, but it's painfully easy to get it right in a majority of the cases. One timing puzzle in particular threw me for a loop before I realized that brute force was NOT the way to go, and then another one game me some trouble because I kept using the blue portal instead of the orange one but that was entirely my own fault. But the overall sense of logic and rules pervaded, leaving an INCREDIBLY SATISFYING taste in my mouth after each victory, plus a joke as a reward.

The music was a bit mechanical and rough around the edges but it was great background noise. The glados voice is really jaded for some unexplained reason but I'd like to assume this takes place after she takes the facility back from Chell at the end of the second game and she's bored of science for some reason and is running dry on things to do to the subjects that Atlas and P-body rescued, so I can forgive that in a 100% FREE mod since clearly the puzzles were the very first order of business and everything else was just an afterthought. And yeah there are a few parts where I'm literally too stupid and impatient to do ~normally~ (specifically the ratman dens rather than the actual story) so resorted to noclip, but that's a fault of my own and not that of the game designer.

All in all this just felt like another slice of cake in a series that I love to death. 9.5/10 for fans of Portal and difficult games and puzzle-platformers in general.
 
NightCoreMoon
0

EDGE Master
81 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.9 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 18 juillet 2018
What I Liked:
Good puzzles
More Portal

What I Didn't Like:
The text to speech robot, holy crap. I'm not normally one to turn off game sounds but I muted all sounds from the game after the 2nd chamber.
Folloing up on the previous point, I didn't really find the dialouge too funny, interesting or... anything really. It felt like they tried to hard to recreate GLaDOS's tone but fell signifacntly short.

Overall, is it a bad game? No. If someone wanted more Portal I'd definitely recommend it. That being said I would warn them about the voice.

8/10
 
pixellich

JWD|Zerocool
146 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
4.0 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 21 avril 2018
A GREAT Portal Mod!

Rexaura is a mod of the Original Portal Game, which was released in 2007. The difficulty level of this mod is slightly higher than that of the original game, but not as high as that of Portal: Prelude.

The puzzles may seem frustrating at first, but as you proceed, you will realize that they usually have very simple or straightforward solutions.

The game is short, but really good.

You will surely enjoy it.

Thank you!

RecommandÃ©
7.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 novembre 2017
Rexaura ist ein Portal 1 Mod und fokussiert sich in jedem Level auf die Anwendung von EnergiebÃ¤llen, welche in Portal 2 bekanntlich entfernt wurden. Bereits nach wenigen Testkammern wird einem bewusst, dass das Spiel fordernder als die zwei Originale ist. Trotz des wirklich hohen Schwierigkeitsgrades sind die LÃ¶sungen stets fair und nachvollziehbar, wodurch Rexaura die optimale Herausforderung fÃ¼r alle bietet, die von Portal nicht genug bekommen kÃ¶nnen und vermehrt ihre grauen Zellen nutzen wollen. Leider Gottes kam ich spÃ¤testens im letzten Drittel sowie bei fast allen Bonuskammern ohne stÃ¤ndige Hilfe nicht mehr voran, wodurch der SpielspaÃŸ nicht mehr existent war. Allerdings wÃ¤re es aufgrund des unglaublich cleveren Leveldesigns wohl eine Schande hier den Daumen nach unten zu geben, da von Anfang bis Ende absolut saubere Arbeit geleistet wurde, die zudem kostenlos angeboten wird.
 
DarkKoopa666
215 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
30.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 octobre 2017
Rexaura is a game I didn't even know that I wanted. While it does repeat some elements more than others and introduces elements that are not used as much, and there is not that much different from regular Portal 2 in terms of mechanisms, the problem solving in the game is very exciting, truly living to its reputation of being challenging. However, the first 12 levels aren't as hard as the description lets on in my opinion, but from that point after critically thinking and logical deduction will be your only friend as you navigate through those levels, as well as astute perception. This game does represent as a whole what the puzzle-strategy genre should strive to be, considering that those who enter that genre are inherently looking for games as Rexaura. if you enjoyed Portal and Portal 2, but their lack of challenge felt incomplete, Rexaura, as it was for me, is the game you need, if you are willing to put the critical thinking, logicial deduction, quick perception, and time into it. GET REXAURA YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT tho, but prepare to be jumping through portals and experimenting with concepts and ideas before creating a coherent solution tho. Kudos to Mevious.
 
jeffrey epstein

10/10

RecommandÃ©
1.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 juin 2017
Quick review (for people who just want to know):

This game is great... ill go over pros and â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥... (for in depth)

Pros:

-This game has its own mechanics and characters

-This game is REALLY well made

-This game has very good level design

-The game has NEW ENERGY PELLETS!!!

â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥:

-This game is HARD

-This game is very repetitive... it has great new mechanics, but uses them over and over again.

-This games voice acting isnt the very best... but its ok.

-The levels were pretty long levels, but thats opinion based anyway.

Final Thoughts, Opinion, and Overview:

Rexaura is an amazing portal game with new looks and new mechanics, it seems like it would be official and is very good.
The levels are too long for my liking, though.
This game is EXTREMELY high on the difficulty chart, from one to ten, itd be ten. I recommend this game to people who are REALLY good at puzzles, but i dont recommend it to people who arent the best at puzzles.
 
Old_James
39 produits enregistrÃ©s

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
5.1 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 20 juin 2017
It's a pretty amazing mod, and the new elements they added are also amazing as well. As far as story goes, it's mostly just 19 tests and some somewhat interesting dialouge in between them. Not much after that. The tests themselves are pretty hard, had to look up the solution for the last three. If you're a Portal fan and want a real good nostalgia trip, it does a great job of recreating the atmosphere. took me 4.1 hours to complete. In all, I would recommend this to any Portal fan.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 8 juillet 2016
Rexaura (a Portal mod) is an enjoyable game which uses familiar aspects from Portal, and introduces several unique elements not used in the original game. The playthrough was enjoyable and felt complete, the dialogue was witty and had the same dry humor as Portal. The biggest problem I had with the game was the voices used, they didn't seem to hold quite the same realistic pseudo-life of the narration that was in Portal. Recommended, just don't expect phenomenal voice acting/editing.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 avril 2016
What I liked:
  • More portal chambers
  • These could pass as Valve maded levels
  • FREE!!!
  • Adds a couple new mechanics all centered around the energy balls
What You Need to Know:
  • It has Glados voice acting and someone else( it's decent enough)
  • Some levels, you will know what to do, but one thing will stump you( also timing isn't vital to any puzzle, you got some wiggle room)
  • I did use a couple walkthroughs when I got stumped after not knowing the percise way of solving it

My Score:
A

Paid: FREE
Completed in: 4 hours

Mods similar in quality:
  • Portal Stories: Mel
  • Thinking with Time Machine

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
3.6 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 29 mars 2016
Wall of Opinion Text

Rexaura is amazing. It's basically Portal Pro done right a little better. The puzzles are difficult and require immense thinking but when you think of a solution, it's usually easy to execute and move on to the next chamber, and partnered with a great sense of satisfaction, this makes the feeling of finally solving that one test greatly rewarding. One of the only issues I have is that there's too much of a focus on energy ball based puzzles, with little variation. I get that this is supposed to be the theme, but it would be nice to have a chamber that didn't reolve exclusively around those energy balls.

Anyways, I give this game a 7/10.

Baguetteaboutit
54 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
9.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 27 fÃ©vrier 2016
Now that's a respectable mod! It really doesn't fall below the quality level of the original Portal, and assuming that you already own the title, it's free! So, if you enjoyed Portal there's no reason to ignore this one!

The Good:
Well, Portal was rather short, and among the many mods the game has (which I haven't really tried as of now) there's this truly good one which brings you another 19 brand new levels..
It has a rather similar setting and concept to those of Portal, with new puzzles.
This mod centers mainly on puzzles which involves pellets, and it adds some new rules and little adjustments to the old "rules" we were used to from Portal. Nothing serious, and you'll be quickly introduced and filled in, and enjoy this nice mod.
It shows some very innovative and original puzzles, where you'll have to think and squeeze you're brain to proceed.
The creator of the mod also created original soundtrack for it, which is quite cool and fits well, and is even slightly better than the original Portal soundtrack in my opinion.
Still here?
Just try it, would you?

The Bad (?):
Well, if anyone's reached here..
There's actually nothing wrong with Rexaura, only thing that I didn't like much is the story, which is, and games of this type, is rather minor and can easily be ignored. Rexaura shows a different story than Portal's but it tries to catch with its spirit. There are some nice lines, but mostly I felt like it's a somewhat cheesy imitation to the original story. Didn't like the ending at all, too, BUT, this is nothing too bad, really. And surely not a reason to avoid playing this.

Enjoying this mod is actually a matter of your own personal taste, as I said earlier, this mod concentrates on pellets-related puzzles. Which is not bad, but not anyone would like it. I did get a bit tired of it towards the end of the game, and while playing the bonus levels (which were great nonetheless!) , and the more portals-related puzzles were missing. But then again, the puzzles are done very well and are totally worth the time!

The Ugly:
I think there's only one technical problem with the game, I didn't try to investigate it too much and it might just be my computer, but, at some point the game would randomly just crush into a black screen, where I'm actually forced to restart the computer as there's no other way to snap out of it!
This does not happen with any other game, nor with the original Portal.
Pretty sure it's something to do with the handling of the saves files, as this issue seemed to occur more and more often as I progressed through the game and added more and more save files. When I tried to delete a couple of saves, the issue didn't occur much.
Hopefully that advice would help someone one day?
Who knows
Otherwise, I doubt anyone even got this far!
 
Ran
