Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
2.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 22 fÃ©vrier 2016
I didn't really enjoy the high-energy pellets in Portal 1 because of their time limit, and they were replaced by lasers in Portal 2 for this excact reason. However, Rexaura is more about finding a way to set things up so that you have more than enough time, making the timing puzzles more puzzle and less timing. There are also green pellets which last indefinitely and give you plenty of time to think. I enjoyed this mod and I recommend it to anyone who likes the Portal trilogy.

For more in-depth commentary and spoilers, you can watch my full playthrough here:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBCsoffCh90q3iQ1LFENm-2ianIuzNgh5

Â¡Â¡Excelente mod!!

Rexaura toma parte del videojuego Portal, haciendo de este un Spin-Off (Derivado) no oficial de la historia de Portal 1.

Los mapas tienen un acabado excelente, las cÃ¡maras de pruebas son realmente complicados, si no tienes suficiente experiencia â™¥â™¥â™¥ los portales sin duda va a ser un reto para un jugador casual en puzles de este tipo de juegos.

Mr. Panacio
554 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
5.3 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 16 janvier 2016
This may be a mod for Portal, but it's a standalone game, with an entire campaign with 19 well-designed chambers. It's a little harder than Portal, so it'll take longer to beat it. The difficulty is never frustrating, although it won't hold your hand. Like the description says, the puzzles main focus is using high-energy pellets in a number of ways, some of them not present in Portal. There's also 3 hidden cakes to find, which unlock 2 advanced chambers and 4 bonus levels, totaling 25 puzzles. Speaking of cakes, the game also has lots of jokes, reminding you of GLaDOS. So, if you own and completed Portal, i recommend you to at least try Rexaura. Despite using the Source engine and Portal mechanics, it's its own beast.

Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 juillet 2015
Meine persÃ¶nliche Portal- Reihung:

Portal 2: 9.5 / 10
Portal Stories - Mel: 9.0 / 10
REXAURA 8.5 / 10
Portal 1: 8.0 / 10
alle anderen: unter 6.0


zu REXAURA:

Dieser Mod ist sehr gut gemacht. Ich fand die Energiekugeln in Portal 1 nicht gut und war froh, dass diese in Portal 2 verschwunden waren. Daher habe ich mich zuerst geziert, diesen Mod zu spielen.
GlÃ¼cklicherweise habe ich es jetzt nachgeholt und wurde positiv Ã¼errascht:

Das Leveldesign ist sehr gut (besser als in Portal 1) und wirklich clever. Die ersten, der insgesamt 19 Testkammern, sind zwar noch recht einfach. Aber ab Level 7 wird es richtig gut. Jedes Level erfordert Nachdenken und bietet eine intelligente LÃ¶sung. (In einem Level konnte ich mit der Holzhammermethode auch eine AlternativlÃ¶sung erzielen).
Die Mechaniken werden am Anfang gut vorgestellt. Es handelt sich mehr oder weniger nur um Portale und natÃ¼rlich Engergiekugeln, die der Hauptdarsteller in allen Leveln sind. Insgesamt troz einfacher Mechaniken rehct komplexe Level, ohne das sie Ã¼berladen wirken, um die KomplexitÃ¤t zu erzeugen.
Dieser Mod zielt wie die 2 Originale nicht auf Timing und PrÃ¤zision ab, sondern erfordert reines Nachdenken. Und das ist gut so!

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist etwas hÃ¶her als in den beiden Originalen. Insgesamt brauchte ich 3.5 h ohne Hilfe.

100 % Weiterempfehlung bei perfektem Preis/ LeistungsverhÃ¤tnis ;)

 
villacco
51 produits enregistrÃ©s
0
Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile
0
RecommandÃ©
7.7 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 7 juillet 2015
This mod, as advertised, focuses on the mechanics of high energy pellets and a couple new things that they interact with. Literally every puzzle will involve with the pellets as the center, with about the first half involving a blue-only portal gun. I see many reviews complaining about too many pellets, but that's what it says on the packaging so I don't know what they expected.

Rexaura has 20 chapters and 6 extra rooms (2 advanced and 4 bonus); three of which require you to find secret cakes hidden in the later chapters. Two of the mechanisms to the secret cake rooms were noticeable, but I quickly forgot about them, as I was unaware of the cakes at the time. The second cake room is not very obvious to me at all and I never noticed it, nor would I think to look there, but someone very perceptive may find a switch in a window.

After beating the campaign, collecting the cakes, collecting the cakes again***, and completing all the extra rooms, this mod lasted me over 7 hours. I am also an idiot and it takes me a while to use brain so I'm sure that this will vary a lot from person to person.

***There is a very particular way to get the achievement for collecting all three cakes. Many people might learn about the cakes after completing the story and then hop back to the specific chapters and get the cakes, but you actually need to collect all three cakes in one save. So that's chapters 11 through 18 you have to do consectively. If you mess it up (chapter select the cakes) you may have to delete gamestate.txt in Rexaura->rexaura, as stated by the dev, before trying the right way.

All of the puzzles are completely logic-based, no trickery involved. The first few chapters (and a couple of the bonus chapters) are fairly easy, though I found that after that there was no curve, just straight into the real business. IMO significantly more difficult than Portal and I must admit that I peeked at YouTube for a couple of hints, though I wish I hadn't, as it was very fun to whisper "alright" to myself in the dark when I solved one on my own.

This time there are two AI(??) voices that berate you in Rexaura, a male and female. They are both quite a bit more funny, feisty, and sarcastic than Glados, but although they say some dark things they are nowhere near as unsettling. I like their voice acting quite a bit, and I think I like the characters more than Glados herself. Though I think I would've liked more banter between them than knocks at the player, like old comedy duos. That would've been perfect.

Overall this mod feels more like a real expansion pack to the game than fan-made content due to how well it is put together. Although there is some silly "mysterious surprise" suspense and a twist, the story is not much, but that's not at all what it's about. I'd highly recommend it to anybody wanting more Portal out of their Portal.
 
Scut
237 produits enregistrÃ©s
0

After playing Portal 2 and some of its great mods (Portal Stories: Mel and Aperture Tag), I enjoyed the nostalgic value of high energy pellets as offered by Rexaura.

And while the mod doesn't go as crazy as it could with its chambers or its story, it feels polished and offers a challenge.

Inoltre il doppiaggio Ã¨ buono, â™¥â™¥â™¥ due voci, una somigliante a Glados. L'umirismo non Ã¨ spumeggiante come nei giochi originali ma in alcuni momenti ci si avvicina bene.

Da fan di Portal non posso che essere entusiasta e consigliare a tutti di giocarlo, ci sono anche le mappe bonus avanzate e qualche piccolo segreto.

Colonna sonora fantastica, perfettamente nello stile del gioco originale.

Personne n'a trouvÃ© cette Ã©valuation utile

RecommandÃ©
5.5 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 24 mai 2015
Please check out my other reviews if you have time.

So...Rexaura? What's new? Some sort of stupid mod with ridiculously hard puzzles? Horrible dialogue? Stupid, unfunny jokes? PewDiePie references everywhere? That's what this mod seems like at first glance. But when you put it in your library, I can say that your vision on the limitations of a Portal mod will change, forever. This mod is the best mod when it comes to the complicity of the puzzles and it always has those: "Holy sh!t, I got it! I know how to solve the puzzle! Aha!" moments when you solve a difficult puzzle. It's a great mod with hard puzzles, real challenging for the Portal fan who requests more...difficulty. There is a nice ending, but i'm not going to spoil it to you. or maybe that character going back up the lift in the end is you after all? Hmph, this is difficult. The main focus of the game is not the feelings, the soundtrack, the feeling of isolation, but the puzzles. Yes, the puzzles.

tl;dr This mod is great at difficulty of puzzles and you should give it a try.

Verdict: 46/48. Sadly, the missing 2 are because of the difficulty of the puzzles and due to the fact this is not a beginner mod, which means you shouldn't try this out if you are not familiar with Portal.
 
Ogadei
0

RecommandÃ©
10.4 h en tout
Ã‰valuation publiÃ©e le 26 dÃ©cembre 2014
It isn't just simple flinging puzzles any more. These are 19 logic-based chambers based entirely around that one green energy pellet that appears in chamber 19 at the end of Portal, and the fact that cubes can deflect pellets. Only problem is that some of the puzzles are skippable by just holding a cube up to a green energy pellet and redirecting it in such a way that it bounces all over the place, eventually landing into the catcher. 9/10
 
ncrecc
